Feb 27.detail: South Korea on Thursday announced the death of its 13th coronavirus patient, a man who was a member of the secretive Shincheonji Church of Jesus, as the number of cases rose to cross 1,500. He had symptoms such as fever and cough on February 20, then reported experiencing shortness of breath a few days later, but died of cardiac arrest in hospital on Thursday morning.

Feb 27.title: South Korea reports 334 additional coronavirus cases, raising total to 1,595
Feb 27.detail: South Korea reported 334 additional cases of the new coronavirus on Thursday (Feb 27), raising the total tally to 1,595. The figure is the largest reported additional cases in the country since its first case was confirmed on Jan 20. Of the new cases, 307 were in the southeastern city of Daegu, where a church that was at the centre of the outbreak is located.

Foreign caregiver announced as Taiwan’s coronavirus case No. 32
Feb 26.detail: The country's 32nd coronavirus patient was an Indonesian woman in her 30s. She had been enrolled as a temporary caregiver for Taiwan's 27th case of Wuhan coronavirus (COVID-19) at the hospital from Feb. 11 through 16. Since No. 27 was announced, his wife, two sons, and an 11-year-old grandson also tested positive for the virus. The boy probably contracted the virus during a visit to his grandfather in the hospital.

Feb 26.title: Thailand has 3 new coronavirus cases, urges travel disclosure
Feb 26.detail: Thailand has confirmed three more novel coronavirus cases, taking the country's total to 40. Two of the new patients, all of whom were Thai nationals, had returned from vacation in Japan's northern island of Hokkaido and came into contact with the third patient, an 8-year old boy. The male patient had not disclosed his travel history when he first sought medical attention and risked becoming a super-spreader. The patient came into contact with 30 medical personnel at the hospital, who later tested negative for the virus and are in self-quarantine at home.

Feb 25.title: Coronavirus, 325 cases in Italy. Three more deaths in Lombardy and one in Veneto
Spain confirms new case of coronavirus in Catalonia - La Vanguardia
Man infected with coronavirus in Germany after Italy trip
Feb 25.detail: A 25-year-old man living in the southern German state of Baden-Wuerttemberg tested positive for the coronavirus on Tuesday after a trip to Milan.

Feb 25.title: First coronavirus case in Algeria
Feb 25.detail: Algeria has reported its first confirmed case of the new coronavirus, an Italian man who arrived in the country on Feb. 17 and has been put into isolation.

Feb 25.title: Italy death toll jumps to 11 as coronavirus spreads through Europe and beyond
Feb 25.detail: The death toll in Italy has risen to 11 and infections to 322, the largest number of people infected in Europe. All of those who have died so far in Italy were either elderly or had pre-existing medical conditions.

Feb 25.title: France reports two new coronavirus infections, one returning from Italy
Feb 25.detail: Two more people were infected with the coronavirus in France on Tuesday, one a French man returning from a trip in the Lombardy region of Italy, the other a young Chinese woman returning to France from a trip to China.  The two new infections take the total number of people who have been infected in France to 14. One of those 14 people has died and 11 have been cured and have left the hospital.

Feb 25.title: CDC official warns Americans it's not a question of if coronavirus will spread, but when
Feb 25.detail: One of the top officials at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention warned Americans on Tuesday that health experts foresee the novel coronavirus that has killed thousands spreading in the United States. The number of cases in the United States has risen to 57, with four more patients who were on a cruise ship.

Thailand reports two new COVID-19 cases, bringing total to 37
Feb 25.detail: Thailand confirmed two new cases of the coronavirus, a senior health official said, bringing the total number of infections in the country to 37. Both of the new cases are Thai nationals. One patient is a female, 31, and has a family member with a history of travelling from China. The second is 29, a male driver for Chinese tourists.

Feb 25.title: Fourth passenger from cruise ship dies in Japan
Feb 25.detail: A fourth passenger from the cruise ship 'Diamond Princess' moored in Japan has died from the coronavirus. The passenger was in their 80s.

Feb 25.title: South Korea now biggest cluster outside China as 60 new cases take total to 893
Feb 25.detail: South Korea reported 60 more novel coronavirus cases on Tuesday. The country now has 893 cases, the largest national total anywhere outside China. South Korea also reported its eighth fatality from the virus, a man in his 60s who was linked to a hospital in Cheongdo, where several infections has been reported among patients who had been hospitalised at a psychiatric ward. For the previous three days, KCDC had reported triple-digit increases each morning as the outbreak took hold in the world's 12th-largest economy.

Feb 24.title: Italian National Becomes Third Case of Coronavirus in Spain
Feb 24.detail: An Italian man has tested positive for coronavirus in Tenerife in the Canary Islands. Spanish media including El Mundo reported the man was an Italian doctor on holiday in Spain. He is the third person to test positive for the virus in Spain after a British man in Mallorca on Feb. 9 and a German man on the Canary Island of La Gomera on Feb. 1.

Feb 24.title: Second case of coronavirus detected in Bahrain
Feb 24.detail: A second case of the deadly coronavirus has been detected in Bahrain. The second case is a Bahraini woman arriving at the Bahrain International Airport from Iran via Dubai.

Feb 24.title: Kuwait announces three more coronavirus infections
Feb 24.detail: Three more people have been infected with the deadly coronavirus in Kuwait after they arrived from the Iranian city of Mashhad. The first case is a 53-year-old Kuwaiti citizen, the second is a 61-year-old Saudi Arabian citizen. The condition of the two is normal and they are not showing symptoms of the virus. The third case is a 21-year-old of an undisclosed nationality, who has started to show symptoms of the virus.

Feb 24.title: Coronavirus kills 12 in Iran, 61 infected
Feb 24.detail: Twelve people have died and 61 have been infected with the coronavirus in Iran, Tehran's health ministry said on Monday.

Feb 24.title: Northern Italy shut down as coronavirus death toll climbs
Feb 24.detail: The alarmingly fast spread of COVID-19 in Italy, the biggest outbreak beyond Asia, continued Monday after shutting down the wealthy northern parts of the country, where more than 50,000 people in a dozen towns remained in lockdown. By the afternoon, the number of confirmed cases in Italy had reached 229, up from 155 Sunday night. The majority were in the region of Lombardy, whose main city, Milan, is the commercial capital of the country. On Friday, there were only three confirmed cases. The coronavirus has now killed seven Italians, all of them elderly. They were the first nontourist deaths in Europe. Twenty-three Italians with coronavirus were in intensive care Monday.​

Feb 24.title: U.S. CDC confirms 53 coronavirus cases, including repatriated citizens
Feb 24.detail: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said on Monday there were 14 confirmed cases of the coronavirus in the country,  apart from the 39 cases among those evacuated from the Diamond Princess cruise ship and the city of Wuhan in China. The agency said the 14 confirmed cases included two new cases reported from Humboldt County and Sacramento County in California.

Feb 24.title: B.C.'s 7th COVID-19 case connected to woman who flew from Iran
Feb 24.detail: A seventh case of COVID-19 has been diagnosed in British Columbia in the Fraser Health region. The man, in his 40s, is a close contact of a young woman who was diagnosed with the illness caused by the novel coronavirus last week after she travelled back to Vancouver from Iran. Henry said the man had shown symptoms of the illness prior to the positive diagnosis of the woman, and went into isolation last week. He is now in stable condition and recovering at home, as is the woman. Officials have been working to identify those who may have come into contact with the man.

Feb 24.title: 12 new coronavirus cases reported in Japan
Feb 24.detail: Twelve new cases of coronavirus infection were reported around Japan on Monday, bringing the total number of domestic infections, excluding people who were aboard the Diamond Princess cruise ship, to 159.

Feb 24.title: Seventh person dies in Italy as outbreak spreads
Feb 24.detail: A  seventh person is reported to have died in Italy from coronavirus, as the country tries to lock down the spread of the disease - some 50,000 people in a dozen towns are effectively in quarantine.

Feb 24.title: Oman Reports First Two Cases of Coronavirus
Feb 24.detail: Oman's Health Ministry on Monday reported the first two cases of coronavirus infections in the Gulf Arab state. The two Omani women diagnosed with the disease had visited Iran.

Feb 24.title: Five more confirmed cases in Hong Kong including two evacuees from Diamond Princess cruise ship and pair from Buddhist hall
Feb 24.detail: Hong Kong reported two more coronavirus cases late on Monday, both evacuees from the Diamond Princess cruise ship, adding to the five confirmed infections earlier in the day and bringing the city's total to 81. The latest cases are a man and a woman, both aged 57, who showed no symptoms of Covid-19.

Feb 24.title: 1 new reported case in Singapore
Feb 24.detail: Case 90, a 75-year-old Singaporean woman with no recent travel history to China, is linked to The Life Church and Missions Singapore cluster.

Feb 24.title: Iraq reports first coronavirus case in Iranian student
Feb 24.detail: The patient, an Iranian student, entered Iraq before the government shut border crossings and banned the entry of non-Iraqis coming from Iran.

Feb 24.title: 2 more coronavirus cases confirmed in Taiwan as part of family cluster
Feb 24.detail: Taiwan reported two more cases of infection by the coronavirus (COVID-19) on Monday (Feb. 24), with the 29th and 30th cases being part of a family cluster that was first recorded on Sunday (Feb. 23). The two newly confirmed cases include the younger son (29th case) of the previously identified 80-year-old patient (27th case) in northern Taiwan and his mother (30th case). The son, who is in his 40s, began experiencing a sore throat on Jan. 29, but he did not immediately go to a clinic. It was not until his father was confirmed to have contracted the SARS-like disease on Sunday that he was hospitalized and tested for the virus. The younger son has frequently visited China for work, but he returned to Taiwan from Guangzhou last December. During the Lunar New Year holiday, he met with friends who had also visited China.

Feb 24.title: Coronavirus cases soar in Italy as authorities scramble to find patient zero
Feb 24.detail: Italy's confirmed cases surged from three on Friday morning to more than 200 by Monday. Italy's spike now marks the biggest outbreak outside of Asia. Five people have died and at least 219 others have been infected with the virus in Italy. The bulk of the cases (167) are in the northern region of Lombardy, whose capital is the city of Milan. One person had recovered and that 91 people with the virus were currently in isolation at home.

Feb 24.title: Coronavirus: Iran denies cover-up as death toll rises to 12
Feb 24.detail: Iran's deputy health minister has denied a claim of a cover-up over the new coronavirus disease, as the number of confirmed deaths there rose to 12.

Feb 24.title: South Korea reports 70 more COVID-19 cases, bringing total to 833
Feb 24.detail: South Korea confirmed 70 more COVID-19 cases on Monday (Feb 24) afternoon, bringing its total tally to 833, by far the largest national total outside China. A total of 161 new cases were announced on Monday morning. Of the new cases, 115 were linked to a church in the southeastern city of Daegu after a 61-year-old woman known as 'Patient 31' who attended services there tested positive, according to the Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC). KCDC also reported that the seventh death from the virus was a 62-year-old man from a hospital in Cheongdo - a county that saw surges in confirmed cases along with nearby Daegu in recent weeks.
Afghanistan confirms first COVID-19 case

Feb 24.title: Kuwait reported three cases of Coronavirus disease
Feb 24.detail: Kuwait have reported three cases of Coronavirus disease on Tuesday morning. The three just came back from a visit to Iran.

Feb 24.title: Ministry of Health confirms first case of Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in Bahrain
Feb 24.detail: The Ministry of Health has confirmed the first case of the Coronavirus (COVID-19) in the Kingdom of Bahrain after a Bahraini citizen arriving from Iran was suspected of having contracted the virus, based on emerging symptoms. The patient was transferred to the Ebrahim Khalil Kanoo Medical Centre for immediate testing, treatment and isolation under the supervision of a specialised medical team.

Feb 24.title: South Korea reports 161 new cases, seventh death as infections leap to 763
Feb 24.detail: South Korea reported 161 new cases of the coronavirus, bringing the total number of infected patients in the country to 763 on Monday, a day after the government raised its infectious disease alert to its highest level. Of the new cases, 115 were linked to a church in the southeastern city of Daegu after a 61-year-old woman known as 'Patient 31' who attended services there tested positive, according to the Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC). KCDC also reported the seventh death from the virus, a 62-year-old man from a hospital in Cheongdo, a county that saw surges in confirmed cases along with nearby Daegu in recent weeks. Authorities are still investigating the exact cause of the new outbreak, with Patient 31 having no recent record of overseas travel.

Feb 23.title: New presumptive case of novel coronavirus in Toronto
Feb 23.detail: Ontario health officials say there's a new presumptive case of the novel coronavirus in Toronto. They said a woman arrived in Canada from China on Friday and went to North York General Hospital in Toronto with an intermittent cough. The province said the woman was tested for the new virus, known as COVID-19, and was sent home for self isolation because her illness was mild. Officials said the woman's local tests came back positive for the virus on Sunday and the sample has been sent to the National Microbiology Lab in Winnipeg for confirmation. The province said it's unlikely that the woman was infectious.

Feb 23.title: 2nd Israeli from Diamond Princess tests positive for Coronavirus
Feb 23.detail: Another of the eleven Israeli citizens who returned to Israel after being quarantined on the Diamond Princess cruise ship off the coast of Japan have contracted the Coronavirus, bringing the total number of cases in Israel to two. The patient is being hospitalized in isolation at Sheba Hospital in Tel Hashomer. The patient did not contract the disease in Israel and has been in isolation since arriving in the country. The passengers were flown back to Israel on a private plane on Friday after being evacuated from the ship.  They were all taken straight to Sheba Hospital to be kept in isolation. Four Israeli citizens who had contracted the disease on the ship remain hospitalized in Japan.

Feb 23.title: Coronavirus: Venice Carnival closes as Italy imposes lockdown
Feb 23.detail: Italian officials have cut short the Venice Carnival as they try to control what is now the worst outbreak of the coronavirus in Europe. Authorities in the Veneto region said the event would end later on Sunday, two days earlier than scheduled. Italy has by far the highest number of coronavirus cases in Europe, with 152. Three people have died. Italy has imposed strict quarantine restrictions in two northern 'hotspot' regions close to Milan and Venice. About 50,000 people cannot enter or leave several towns in Veneto and Lombardy for the next two weeks without special permission. Even outside the zone, many businesses and schools have suspended activities, and sporting events have been cancelled including several top-flight football matches.

Feb 23.title: Four new UK coronavirus cases among ship evacuees
Feb 23.detail: Four cruise ship passengers flown to Britain on Saturday have tested positive for coronavirus, bringing the total number of cases in the UK to 13. They were among 30 repatriated Britons and two Irish citizens beginning a 14-day quarantine at Arrowe Park Hospital in Wirral. The four UK nationals caught the virus on the Diamond Princess liner in Japan. They have now been transferred to specialist NHS infection centres. Two patients are in the Royal Hallamshire in Sheffield, one is in the Royal in Liverpool and a fourth was transferred to the Royal Victoria Infirmary in Newcastle.

Feb 23.title: 57 more people on Diamond Princess have virus
Feb 23.detail: Japanese authorities say 57 more people on board the quarantined Diamond Princess have tested positive for the new coronavirus. This brings the total number of virus carriers found on the cruise ship to 691.

Feb 23.title: Japan caught in the grip of a virus delivered by sea and air
Feb 23.detail: Another 130 or so Japanese who had nothing to do with the cruise ship, have fallen ill, too. Among them have been: two young brothers in northern Japan; a father and son who flew out of Wuhan, China, on a charter flight three weeks ago with other evacuees; a healthcare worker; a four-year-old and, even more concerning, a middle school teacher who was conducting classes near Tokyo until just three days ago.

Feb 23.title: Iran says in total 43 infected with coronavirus, 8 dead
Feb 23.detail: Iran confirmed 15 new cases of the new coronavirus on state TV on Sunday (Feb 23), adding that the death toll has reached eight in the country. Since Wednesday Iran had confirmed 28 cases in total and seven deaths from the new coronavirus.

Feb 23.title: Four more Hong Kong passengers evacuated from Diamond Princess test positive
Feb 23.detail: Four more Hongkongers who flew home from the quarantined Diamond Princess cruise ship in Japan preliminarily tested positive for the deadly coronavirus on Sunday, as the number of confirmed infections in the city rose to 74. 193 Hong Kong passengers were evacuated from the cruise ship, sparking concerns more could be infected. Earlier in the day, the health authorities announced that four more people in the city were confirmed to have contracted the coronavirus, including two elderly women who recently visited a North Point Buddhist worship hall. The Centre for Health Protection said the 71st case was a 68-year-old man who recently flew back to Hong Kong on a government-chartered flight from the quarantined Diamond Princess cruise ship in Japan. The 72nd case is a 62-year-old man who lives in and works as a security guard at Choi Tin House, Hing Tin Estate in Lam Tin. He had not travelled outside Hong Kong recently.  He attended a company dinner with 17 others at a restaurant in the Silvercord shopping centre in Tsim Sha Tsui on February 10. The 73rd case is a 80-year-old woman who frequently visits Fook Wai Ching She Buddhist worship hall at the Maylun Apartments building on King's Road in North Point. She last went there on Feruary 8. The 74th case is a 76-year-old woman who lives in Maylun Apartments and visited the worship hall every morning. She developed a fever on February 13.

Feb 23.title: Taiwan's COVID-19 cases rise to 28
Feb 23.detail: Two more cases of infection by the coronavirus (COVID-19) were recorded on Sunday (Feb. 23), raising the number of confirmed cases in Taiwan to 28. A man in his 80s from northern Taiwan and his 50-year-old son were identified as, respectively, the 27th and 28th cases of the viral infection. The source of infection is still under investigation, as the father and son have not traveled overseas recently. However, the CECC said another son of the man in his 80s frequently visited China, including Wuhan City, but he returned to Taiwan on Dec. 2, from the Chinese city of Guangzhou. The younger son of the 27th case met with friends who had also visited China, during the Lunar New Year holiday. The 80-year-old father, who suffers from diabetes and has high blood pressure, started coughing and sneezing on Feb. 6, after which he was diagnosed as having pneumonia and treated at a single ward on Feb. 9. The man was transferred to intensive care on Feb. 16 after suffering severe respiratory distress. Later, he was moved to a negative pressure isolation ward on Feb. 20 as  his physician suspected the man of having contracted tuberculosis. The next day, the hospital decided to test him for the coronavirus. His infection was confirmed on Sunday. The 28th patient, who lives with his father (27th case), had a fever, running nose, and sore throat on Jan. 31. He was diagnosed with pneumonia on Feb. 8 by the emergency clinic after having a persistent fever. The man went to the clinic on Feb. 11 and 18, and it was not until Feb. 21 that he was isolated in the hospital and tested for the virus. The CECC has begun isolating and testing a total of 115 medical staffers that had close contact with the infected individuals.

Feb 23.title: S. Korea reports 4th coronavirus death as cases spike to 556
Feb 23.detail: South Korea reported its fourth death from the new coronavirus on Sunday and added 123 new cases to bring the total confirmed cases to 556. Three of the four coronavirus deaths were from Daenam Hospital in the southeastern city of Cheongdo, where the country's first COVID-19 fatality took place and more than 110 people, including nine medical staff, were found to be infected. The number of COVID-19 infections more than doubled in a single day on Saturday, with most cases centered around a religious organization in the country's fourth-largest city of Daegu and the neighboring Daenam Hospital. Of the 123 new cases, 75 are related to worship services of the Shincheonji church in the southeastern city of Daegu. The infected cases that can be traced to the church services hovered above 300 as of Sunday morning, accounting for more than half of the total cases here. The KCDC said it has placed more than 9,000 Shincheonji members in self-quarantine. Some 90 new cases were in Daegu, which has a population of roughly 2.5 million, with 20 new virus incidents reported in the surrounding North Gyeongsang Province. Gwangju and Jeju also reported one more case each, while the southern port city of Busan reported two more patients, in a sign that the virus may spread quickly nationwide. The number of people being checked for the virus and under quarantine came to 6,039, it added. The country has tested a total of 22,633 suspected cases, with 16,038 testing negative. South Korea confirmed its first new coronavirus case from a Chinese woman from Wuhan, the epicenter of the virus outbreak, on Jan. 20. The country's 31st patient, a probable 'super spreader', had attended Shincheonji's worship services in Daegu.

Feb 22.title: COVID-19: Two dead, 79 infected in Italy as government shuts down worst hit areas
Feb 22.detail: Cases of the new coronavirus in Italy, the most affected country in Europe, rose on Saturday to nearly 80, killing two people and prompting the government to close off the worst hit areas in the northern regions of Lombardy and Veneto.

Feb 22.title: COVID-19: Iran confirms 6th person has died from virus
Feb 22.detail: Iranian officials reported a sixth death from the new COVID-19 virus Saturday. Tests of a patient who recently died in the central city of Arak were positive for the virus. The person was also suffering from a heart problem.

Feb 22.title: Two dead, 58 infected as Italy's coronavirus outbreak reaches Milan
Feb 22.detail: Cases of the new coronavirus in Italy, the worst affected country in Europe, rose on Saturday to above 60, including two people who have died, and spread to the financial capital Milan. Authorities in the northern regions of Lombardy and Veneto, where the outbreak is concentrated, have shut down schools and banned public events while companies from Ray-Ban owner Luxottica to the country's top bank UniCredit have told workers living in the worst hit areas to stay home. Lombardy and Veneto represent Italy's industrial heart and jointly account for 30% of gross domestic output. The first death was a 76-year-old woman who was found dead at her home 50 km (30 miles) south of Milan on Thursday and tested positive for the coronavirus.  A 78-year-old man died of the infection in a hospital near Padua on Friday night. The man's wife and daughter are among 12 people infected by the coronavirus in the Veneto region, where authorities are considering suspending Carnival of Venice events currently taking place. Lombardy Governor Attilio Fontana said patients in his region totalled 46, including a man currently at San Raffaele hospital in Milan. The city has a population of 1.4 million. The outbreak originated in Codogno, a small town southeast of Milan where Lombardy's first infected patient was treated. That patient was a 38-year-old man, who fell ill after meeting a friend who had visited China. His condition has stabilized. All those who have tested positive are people who on February 18-19 had contacts with the emergency room and the hospital of Codogno. 259 people had been screened in the area in the past two days and 35 had tested positive.

Feb 22.title: UAE confirms two new cases of coronavirus bringing total to 13
Feb 22.detail: The UAE's health ministry confirmed two new cases of coronavirus on Saturday, bringing the country's total to 13. An Iranian tourist, 70 and his wife, 64, tested positive for the virus. The man was in an 'unstable' condition and in intensive care on Saturday,

Feb 22.title: Hong Kong confirms 70th infection
Feb 22.detail: An 96-year-old woman on Saturday became the 70th person confirmed as infected with the deadly coronavirus in Hong Kong. She was sent to Pamela Youde Nethersole Eastern Hospital, in Chai Wan, after having difficulty breathing. She had visited the Fook Wai Ching She Buddhist worship hall at Maylun Apartments on King's Road in North Point in January and February. The city's 65th confirmed patient also recently visited the hall.

Feb 22.title: 3 more confirmed COVID-19 cases in Singapore
Feb 22.detail: Singapore reported three more confirmed cases of COVID-19 on Saturday. This brings the number of cases in the country to 89. The latest confirmed cases include one from the cluster at Grace Assembly of God, and one was among the group of Singaporeans who were evacuated from Wuhan on Feb 9. For the third case, contact tracing is under way to establish any links to previous cases or travel history to China.

Feb 22.title: Iran now says 5 dead out of 28 infected with new coronavirus
Feb 22.detail: Iranian health authorities on Saturday reported a fifth death from the new virus that emerged in China, and said the fatality was from among 10 new confirmed cases of the virus in Iran. So far, 28 cases have been confirmed in Iran, including the five who died. People are being treated for the virus in at least four different cities, including the capital, Tehran, where some pharmacies had already run out of masks and hand sanitizer. Other cities are Qom, Arak and Rasht.

Feb 22.title: Coronavirus: 'Panic' in South Korea as 229 new cases reported, most linked to Daegu church
Feb 22.detail: South Korea on Saturday reported an eight-fold jump in viral infections in four days to 433, most of them linked to a church and a hospital in and around the fourth-largest city where health workers scrambled to screen more than 9,000 worshippers. Of the 229 new cases, 200 are from Daegu and nearby regions, which have emerged as the latest front in the widening global fight against Covid-19. There's concern that the death toll, currently at three, could grow. Virus patients with signs of pneumonia or other serious conditions at the Cheongdo hospital were transferred to other facilities, 17 of them in critical condition.

Feb 22.title: Coronavirus COVID-19 cases climb by two among Diamond Princess cruise ship evacuees in Darwin
Feb 22.detail: Another two people evacuated from the Diamond Princess cruise ship to Australia have tested positive for coronavirus, taking the number of confirmed cases to six. Health authorities confirmed two Victorians tested positive for COVID-19 overnight after four people were diagnosed with the virus on Friday — a woman from SA, a man from WA and two people from Queensland.

Feb 22.title: Junior high school teacher infected
Feb 22.detail: A teacher in her 60s at a public junior high school east of Tokyo has been confirmed to be infected with the virus. She showed symptoms of nausea while teaching in Chiba prefecture . The mayor of Chiba city says the school will be closed until next Wednesday. The teacher has no record of overseas travel in the past 2 weeks and is not known to have been in contact with an infected person.

Feb 22.title: South Korea reports 142 more COVID-19 cases, total 346
Feb 22.detail: South Korea on Saturday (Feb 22) reported 142 more cases of novel coronavirus, bringing the nationwide total to 346.  This is the highest number of people infected outside of China.  On Friday afternoon, a total of 100 new cases were confirmed with 85 of them connected to the Shincheonji Church of Jesus in the southern city of Daegu.  The mayor of Daegu - South Korea's fourth-biggest city, with a population of over 2.5 million - has advised locals to stay indoors, while access to a major US military base in the area has been restricted.

Feb 21.title: CDC has confirmed 34 cases of novel coronavirus in the US
Feb 21.detail: US officials have now confirmed 34 of novel coronavirus in the country. These include 21 cases among repatriated individuals, as well as 13 US cases. The 21 repatriated include 18 former passengers of the Diamond Princess cruise ship that docked in Japan, plus three who had been previously evacuated from China. There are 10 additional passengers among the Diamond Princess evacuees who tested positive for the virus in Japan, and who Messonnier said will likely be added to the official US count once the Japanese test results have been adjudicated. The 13 US cases include seven in California, one in Massachusetts, one in Washington state, one in Arizona, two in Illinois and one in Wisconsin. Among these cases, there are two instances of person-to-person transmission, one in Illinois and one in California.

Feb 21.title: Coronavirus outbreak grows in northern Italy, 16 cases reported in one day
Feb 21.detail: An outbreak of COVID-19 in northern Italy worsened on Friday (Feb 21), with officials announcing 14 confirmed cases in the wealthy region of Lombardy, while two cases were reported in the adjacent region of Veneto.

Feb 21.title: UAE records two new coronavirus cases, total number reaches 11
Feb 21.detail: The United Arab Emirates said on Friday it had registered two new coronavirus cases, bringing the total number of people diagnosed with the virus in the Gulf Arab state to 11. The new cases in the UAE were detected in a 34-year-old Filipino national and a 39-year-old Bangladeshi national who had contact with a Chinese national who had been diagnosed with the virus. The two are in stable condition.

Feb 21.title: Two Queenslanders tested positive for Coronavirus (COVID-19).
Feb 21.detail: Two women, aged 54 and 55, had been evacuated from the Diamond Princess cruise ship to Howard Springs outside of Darwin. Tonight they have tested positive to coronavirus (COVID-19) and will transported to a Brisbane hospital while they recover. There have only been five confirmed cases of the virus in Queensland so far.

Feb 21.title: 3 children among new cases
Feb 21.detail: Nine new cases of coronavirus infection were reported in Japan on Friday. Officials in the northern prefecture of Hokkaido said three people have been infected with the virus, including two elementary school students. A boy in Saitama Prefecture, located north of Tokyo, also tested positive. He flew back to Japan from the Chinese city of Wuhan on a chartered flight late last month. His father, who was also in China, was confirmed to be infected last week. Five other cases were reported in Tokyo, Chiba and Ishikawa prefectures.

Feb 21.title: 1 new confirmed case: MOH
Feb 21.detail: Singapore reported one more confirmed case of COVID-19 , bringing the number of cases in the country to 86. The latest confirmed case is a 24-year-old Singapore Institute of Technology student from Singapore. He has no recent travel history to China and is linked to Case 82, a 57-year-old Singaporean woman.

Feb 21.title: First case of coronavirus reported in Lebanon
Feb 21.detail: The first case of the coronavirus has been reported in Lebanon, according to MTV Lebanon. The patient is being transferred to the Rafik Hariri University Hospital in Beirut.

Feb 21.title: Israel confirms first coronavirus case as cruise ship returnee diagnosed
Feb 21.detail: One of 11 Israeli travelers who returned to the country early Friday after being quarantined for the last two weeks on a cruise ship off Japan's coast tested positive for coronavirus Friday, marking the first case of the novel COVID-19 virus in the Jewish state.

Feb 21.title: WHO officials say coronavirus outbreak in Iran is ‘very worrisome’
Feb 21.detail: World health officials said Friday the COVID-19 coronavirus outbreak in Iran, where health officials confirmed 18 new cases and four deaths in just two days, is 'very worrisome'. Earlier in the day, Iran confirmed 13 new coronavirus cases, bringing its total in the country to 18. Seven people with the flu-like virus were diagnosed in Qom, four people in Tehran and two in Gilan. The small outbreak in Iran has been linked to a case in Canada and another infection of a 45-year-old woman in Lebanon after those patients traveled to the Middle East nation.

Feb 21.title: Taiwan confirms two new coronavirus cases, bringing total to 26
Feb 21.detail: Taiwan on Friday (Feb. 21) confirmed two new cases of Wuhan coronavirus (COVID-19), bringing the total to 26. The two new patients were a daughter and granddaughter of the 24th case. The 60-year-old woman confirmed as a coronavirus patient on Thursday (Feb. 20) had not left the country for at least two years. Following four visits to clinics late last month, she was diagnosed with pneumonia and admitted to a hospital. She was moved to an intensive care unit on Feb. 10 after her condition worsened, with the coronavirus diagnosis following more than a week later. Her two family members, a daughter in her 40s and a granddaughter in her 20s, both residents of northern Taiwan.  Neither woman had recently traveled overseas.

Feb 21.title: 6th presumptive case of the COVID-19 virus found in B.C.
Feb 21.detail: The latest patient is a woman in her 30s who lives in the Fraser Health region. She had recently returned from a trip to Iran and is now recovering at home. The woman's infection as relatively mild. She has had contact with others since her return from Iran last week. Close family members are currently in isolation and being monitored by public health officials. The woman only visited Iran during her travels. That country has recently announced five cases of the COVID-19 virus and two deaths.

Feb 21.title: South Korea reports 52 new COVID-19 cases, brings total to 156
Feb 21.detail: South Korea reported 52 new confirmed cases of the coronavirus, taking the national tally to 15.

Feb 21.title: Hmboldt County, California has confirmed its first case of coronavirus
Feb 21.detail: The Department of Health and Human Services has confirmed its first case of coronavirus in Humboldt County.

Feb 20.title: Coronavirus cases confirmed among Australian Diamond Princess evacuees in Darwin
Feb 20.detail: The two infected patients were aboard the coronavirus-hit Diamond Princess cruise ship.

Feb 20.title: A 38-year-old Italian tested positive for the coronavirus test
Feb 20.detail: The 38-year-old had no recent travel history in China but made contacts with other Italians who recently returned from China.

Feb 20.title: Police officer becomes 69th person infected in Hong Kong
Feb 20.detail: A policeman has become the first officer to contract the deadly coronavirus in Hong Kong, taking the city's total of infected patients to 69. The Post was told the 48-year-old – the first policeman to be infected – had been to a farewell banquet for a colleague on February 18 attended by about 60 people, who would all need to be quarantined. The officer is attached to the patrol sub-unit of North Point Police Station, and assigned to the tier-three platoon of the Hong Kong Island regional response contingent, which consists of 40 officers, who could now be treated as close contacts. His wife and mother-in-law also showed symptoms of infection, and had been taken to hospital.

Feb 20.title: 1 new COVID-19 case in Singapore
Feb 20.detail: Singapore reported one new confirmed COVID-19 case on Thursday (Feb 20), bringing the number of cases in the country to 85. The latest confirmed case is a 36-year-old male work pass holder from China.  He has no recent travel history to China. 37 people have now fully recovered from the virus. Forty-eight patients remain in hospital, with four in critical condition.

Feb 20.title: 13 more infections confirmed on Diamond Princess cruise ship
Feb 20.detail: 13 new cases were confirmed on the Diamond Princess, which has been quarantined since February 3, initially with about 3,700 people on board. The new cases take the overall number of infections on board to 634.

Feb 20.title: Japan reports more cases outside ship
Feb 20.detail: Japan's health authorities confirmed seven new cases of coronavirus infection on Thursday. That brings the total number of patients outside passengers and crew from the ship to over 90. Among the new cases, a man in his 80s has tested positive in Kanagawa. He had been staying at a hospital where an elderly woman who died from the virus had received care. And in Fukuoka, a man in his 60s became the first patient in the Kyushu region.

Feb 20.title: Iran announces 3 new cases of new virus after 2 deaths
Feb 20.detail: Iran said Thursday that three more people have been infected with the new virus that originated in central China, following an announcement the day before that two people had died of the illness caused by the virus in the Iranian city of Qom. All three new cases are all Iranians residing in Qom, with one of the infected having visited the city of Arak. They did not appear to have had any contact with Chinese nationals.

Feb 20.title: S. Korea reports 1st death from virus, cases soar to 104
Feb 20.detail: South Korea reported its first death from the new coronavirus on Thursday, with 53 new cases of the coronavirus confirmed in a single day to bring the total here to 104. Most new cases occurred in the southeastern city of Daegu. The city's mayor urged its 2.5 million people to refrain from going outside to stem the spread of the virus. This week's surge in the number of infected people, increasing the nation's total infections by more than 70, came as the health authorities warned that the virus has begun spreading locally. The health authorities have been adjusting its quarantine and prevention work to cope with local transmission. The authorities kept the virus alert level at 'orange', the third highest. Of the 53 new cases, 51 are in Daegu, 300 kilometers southeast of Seoul, and neighboring North Gyeongsang Province. The remaining two were reported in Seoul. Of the 51 new cases in Daegu, 23 patients are believed to be linked to a 61-year-old South Korean woman who was confirmed to be infected Tuesday. The country's first patient presumed to have died from the coronavirus had been receiving treatment at a hospital in the southeastern city of Cheongdo. Confirmation of his infection was revealed after he died of pneumonia on Wedensday.

Feb 20.title: Taiwan reports new coronavirus case with unknown origin
Feb 20.detail: A woman in Taiwan with no history of overseas travel over the past two years has been infected with COVID-19 coronavirus. A further investigation will be conducted to determine if the case is the result of community-level transmission of the virus in Taiwan. The woman in her 60s living in northern Taiwan, is the 24th person in the country to be confirmed with the respiratory disease.

Feb 20.title: Two coronavirus patients from Diamond Princess cruise ship in Japan have died
Feb 20.detail: Two passengers, a man and woman in their 80s from a coronavirus-hit cruise ship moored near Tokyo have died, as a second group of passengers began disembarking after two-weeks quarantined on-board. Both passengers had underlying conditions and had been taken off the ship on February 11 and 12 before being treated in hospital. More than 620 of the passengers on the Diamond Princess liner have been infected on the ship, which has been quarantined since February 3, with about 3,700 people on board.

Feb 20.title: New virus confirmed in men in his 60s in Fukuoka City. First confirmed case in Kyushu
Feb 20.detail: Fukuoka City has confirmed that a men in his 60s have been infected with the new coronavirus. It is the first time that the new coronavirus has been confirmed in Kyushu. The man has never traveled abroad, including China.

Feb 20.title: S. Korea reports 31 new cases of coronavirus, total now at 82s
Feb 20.detail: South Korea reported 31 new cases of the new coronavirus on Thursday, bringing the total number of infections in the nation to 82. This week's surge in the number of infected people, increasing the nation's total infections by more than 50, has raised fears that the virus may have been spreading locally. Of the 31 new cases, 30 are in Daegu, 300 kilometers southeast of Seoul, and neighboring North Gyeongsang province. The remaining one was reported in Seoul, the Korea Center for Disease Control and Prevention said in a statement.

Feb 19.title: Two Iranians die after testing positive for coronavirus
Feb 19.detail: Two Iranians have died from respiratory illness in hospital hours after testing positive for the new coronavirus in the holy Shi’ite city of Qom.

Feb 19.title: One more confirmed coronavirus case reported in Taiwan
Feb 19.detail: Taiwan reported one more confirmed case of COVID-19 coronavirus Wednesday, bringing the number in the country to 23 since the outbreak began. The latest case is the 60-year-old younger sister of the 19th confirmed case -- a 61-year-old male who made his living in central Taiwan as a limousine service driver and on Sunday became the first person in the country to die of the infection.

Feb 19.title: 10 new coronavirus cases reported in Japan
Feb 19.detail: By prefecture, four cases were in Hokkaido; 25 in Tokyo; four in Chiba Prefecture; seven in Kanagawa; eight in Aichi prefectures; one in Mie Prefecture; two each in Okinawa and Kyoto prefectures; one each in Osaka and Nara prefectures; and 12 in Wakayama Prefecture. Furthermore, three government and quarantine officials were confirmed to be infected.

Feb 19.title: 3 new COVID-19 cases in Singapore
Feb 19.detail: Singapore reported three more confirmed cases of COVID-19 on Wednesday (Feb 19), including two patients who are linked to existing church clusters. This brings the number of cases in Singapore to 84, with four in critical condition. Case 82 is a 57-year-old Singaporean woman with no recent travel history to China. Case 83 is a 54 year-old Singaporean man with no recent travel history to China, but who travels frequently to Malaysia for work purposes. He is linked to the The Life Church and Missions Singapore. Case 84 is a 35 year-old Singaporean woman with no recent travel history to China. She is linked to Case 66, a 28-year-old man who works at Grace Assembly of God.

Feb 19.title: Mother-in-law of infected Hong Kong engineer one of three more struck down, taking total confirmed cases in city to 65
Feb 19.detail: The mother-in-law of an engineer infected with the coronavirus was among three new confirmed cases, health officials said on Wednesday, bringing the total in Hong Kong to 65. The infected patient, an 83-year-old woman, is the third person associated with the same family to have been infected with the virus.

Feb 19.title: Iran confirms its first 2 coronavirus cases
Feb 19.detail: Iranian authorities confirmed on Wednesday two cases of the new coronavirus, the first in the country. The report did not elaborate on the nationality of the two people infected by the virus or the state of their health.

Feb 19.title: 79 more cases aboard Diamond Princess cruise ship as quarantine ends and passengers leave
Feb 19.detail: Another 79 cases of the deadly new coronavirus were confirmed on the Diamond Princess cruise ship on Wednesday, hours after passengers began disembarking from the vessel that has been moored off Japan for two weeks. The latest confirmed cases take the overall number of infections aboard the Diamond Princess to 621.

Feb 19.title: S. Korea reports 5 more cases of novel coronavirus, total now at 51
Feb 19.detail: South Korea confirmed 5 more cases of the novel coronavirus Wednesday, bringing the total number of infections here to 51, amid growing concerns that the respiratory illness is spreading across the country despite tighter quarantine measures.

Feb 19.title: Second Hongkonger dies after becoming infected with coronavirus
Feb 19.detail: A 70-year-old Hong Kong coronavirus patient with underlying diabetes and kidney problems has died at 7am, Wednesday morning. He is the second fatality since the outbreak began in the city in mid-January.

Feb 19.title: S. Korea reports 15 more cases of novel coronavirus, total at 46
Feb 19.detail: South Korea confirmed 15 more cases of the novel coronavirus Wednesday, bringing the total number of infections here to 46, amid fears that the respiratory illness is spreading across the country despite tighter quarantine measures. According to the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC), 13 new patients reside in Daegu, 300 kilometers southeast of Seoul and adjacent areas. They are presumed to have contracted the illness via contact with a 68-year-old South Korean woman who was diagnosed with the COVID-19 virus infection Tuesday. The woman, probably a coronavirus 'super spreader', also lives in the city. The health authorities said that the 11-year-old daughter of the country's 20th patient who was confirmed to be infected on Feb. 5 tested positive for the illness, while a 77-year-old man has also been diagnosed with the virus, according to the KCDC. The man has not traveled abroad. All newly infected people have been placed in quarantine and are undergoing treatment.

Feb 18.title: Hong Kong confirms 62nd infection, while mother-in-law of engineer in earlier case tests positive
Feb 18.detail: Hong Kong has confirmed its 62nd case of Covid-19 infection, while the mother-in-law of an engineer who had contracted the coronavirus also tested positive in preliminary checks. Officials revealed that a 58-year-old patient at United Christian Hospital in Kwun Tong was the latest case in the city. The man visited his wife and daughter in Zhongshan city in the southern Chinese province of Guangdong between January 23 and February 2, and made another day trip to Macau on February 5 for work. He developed fever and chills on February 11 and a cough on Saturday, and was sent to hospital on Monday.

Feb 18.title: Taxi driver man in Yokohama unable to talk due to severe pneumonia
Feb 18.detail: A 60-year-old male taxi driver living in Yokohama has been newly infected with the new coronavirus. The driver had a fever on the Feburary 3rd and consulted a medical institution on the 5th, but was diagnosed with a cold. He was hospitalized on the 13th, but was transferred to another medical institution because of severe symptoms. He was confirmed on the 18th that he was infected with the new coronavirus. Currently, he is unable to talk due to severe pneumonia.

Feb 18.title: Another 95 infection cases confirmed in Japan, including 88 new cases on the quarantined Diamond Princess cruise ship
Feb 18.detail: Japanese authorities say nearly 100 people were confirmed on Tuesday to be infected with the new coronavirus, including one person under the age of 20. Three men in Tokyo are among the new cases. Two of them are in serious condition. Three other infections were reported in the western prefecture of Wakayama. Most of the cases there have some link to a local hospital. The youngest of the new cases is the son of an infected doctor. And a man in Aichi Prefecture, central Japan, has also tested positive. The other 88 new cases are people aboard the quarantined cruise ship that's currently docked near Tokyo. That brings the total number of cases from the ship to 542, and the total number across all of Japan to 615.

Feb 18.title: Singapore confirms 4 new cases as biggest cluster around Grace Assembly of God church swells to 21
Feb 18.detail: Singapore on Tuesday confirmed four new cases of the deadly coronavirus, taking the city state's total number of infections to 81. Three of the new cases – a 57-year-old woman, a 38-year-old woman and a 50-year-old man – had no recent travel history to China but have been linked to an existing cluster at a church in Singapore's Tanglin district called the Grace Assembly of God, which connects 21 of the city state's confirmed infections. The other new case is a 35-year-old Malaysian national with a Singapore work pass. She also has no recent travel to history to China but is part of a cluster including three other previously confirmed cases.

Feb 18.title: 88 more people test positive for COVID-19 on Diamond Princess cruise ship
Feb 18.detail: Another 88 people aboard a cruise ship off Japan have tested positive for COVID-19. The new cases take the total number of confirmed cases on the Diamond Princess to 542 - the biggest cluster outside the epicentre in China. The patients will be sent to specialised hospitals. Sixty-five of those who tested positive were not yet showing symptoms. The government earlier on Tuesday said all passengers and crew aboard the ship were tested for the coronavirus. Britain became the latest country to offer its citizens a way off the boat, saying it was working to organise a flight back to the UK. Canada, Australia, Hong Kong and South Korea have already said they will evacuate their citizens from the ship, following the lead from the United States, which flew home around 300 Americans on Monday - including more than a dozen who had tested positive.

Feb 18.title: Filipino domestic helper tests positive taking total number of confirmed cases in city to 61
Feb 18.detail: A domestic helper whose employer was earlier diagnosed with the coronavirus has also been infected, taking the total number of confirmed cases in Hong Kong to 61. The Filipino woman works for a 67-year-old woman who was confirmed as infected on February 13. The employer had been to a meal at Star Seafood Restaurant in North Point, which 29 people attended.

Feb 18.title: S. Korea reports 1 more case of novel coronavirus, total now at 31
Feb 18.detail: South Korea on Tuesday confirmed another case of the novel coronavirus, bringing the total number of infections here to 31. According to the Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC), the latest patient is a 61-year-old South Korean woman who lives in Daegu, 300 kilometers southeast of Seoul. The woman has not been abroad, raising concerns again over the spread of the disease without a link to known clusters of the COVID-19 virus. The number of people being checked for the virus and under quarantine came to 957 as of early Tuesday, up from 708 the day before, the KCDC said. South Korea has screened 9,265 people for COVID-19 since Jan. 3, with 8,277 testing negative and 10 people having been discharged from quarantine after making full recoveries.

Feb 17.title: Taiwan reported two new cases of COVID-19
Feb 17.source: Taiwan Centers for Disease Control (in Chinese)
Feb 17.detail: Taiwan announced two new cases of COVID-19. A women in her 80s (Case 21) and men in his 30s (Case 22). They were relatives of case 19 and case 20 that were reported yesterday.

Feb 17.title: Japan reported a new confirmed coronavirus case. Bring its total to 66
Feb 17.detail: A men in his 60s living in Aichi Prefecture were infected with the new coronavirus. The man is an acquaintance of a patient whose infection was confirmed on the 16th, and this is the sixth such case in Aichi Prefecture.

Feb 17.title: Hospital Authority reveals staff were at a meeting attended by two engineers who later tested positive, as Hong Kong confirms 60th case
Feb 17.detail: The two engineers from architecture firm P&T Group, aged 54 and 45, attended a development project meeting at the Hospital Authority's headquarters on February 6 and 7, which was the last time the co-workers were together. Five authority representatives were also present. The meeting on February 6 was attended by a total of 15 people. Also present were representatives from quantity surveyors Rider Levett Bucknall Limited, planning and development consultant KJL Limited, and engineering firm WSP.

Feb 17.title: Hong Kong confirms 58th case
Feb 17.detail: A 69-year-old retired man from Tseung Kwan O, who has a long term illness, was officially recorded as the city’s 58th Covid-19 case on Monday despite having no recent travel history.

Feb 17.title: 2 new cases reported in Singapore
Feb 17.detail: Two new cases were also been reported on Monday, bringing the total number of confirmed cases in Singapore to 77. Case 76 is a one-year-old boy who was among the group evacuated from Wuhan on Feb 9 and Case 77 is a 35-year-old man, a close contact of case 50.

Feb 17.title: Japan confirms 99 more cases of new virus on cruise ship
Feb 17.detail: Japanese officials have confirmed 99 more people infected by the new virus aboard the quarantined cruise ship Diamond Princess, docked in Yokohama, a port city near Tokyo, bringing the total to 454.  The 14-day quarantine for those on the ship was due to end Wednesday. Outside China, the ship has had the largest number of cases of the COVID-19 illness. The ship had about 3,700 passengers and crew. Two chartered planes flew 340 Americans who were aboard the vessel out of Japan late Sunday. About 380 Americans had been on the ship. 14 evacuees were among the 99 new cases, which included two other Americans and 43 Japanese. Australia, Canada, Hong Kong and Italy were planning similar flights for their citizens.

Feb 17.title: Japan issues guidelines to prevent rush on hospitals as COVID-19 cases surge
Feb 17.detail: Officials in Kanagawa Prefecture said a nurse in her 40s tested positive for the coronavirus. She was working at Sagamihara Chuo Hospital in the city of Sagamihara, where a woman in her 80s, who also tested positive and who died last Thursday, had been hospitalized. The nurse developed a fever on Friday and was diagnosed with coronavirus on Sunday. The health ministry also said one of its officials in his 50s involved in dealing with the Diamond Princess tested positive. He didn't have close contact with passengers and crew members on the ship. However, while he was wearing a mask while working aboard the ship, he took it off when he ate a meal with other officials. An official in Wakayama Prefecture said four more people were confirmed positive on Monday. Three are family members of those already infected at a hospital, but one person had not visited the hospital. Last week, a surgeon in his 50s who worked at the hospital tested positive for the virus. The outbreak has begun to have ripple effects across the nation.

Feb 17.title: Thailand records 1 new case of coronavirus
Feb 17.detail: The new case, a 60-year-old Chinese woman whose family members earlier contracted the virus, takes the total number of cases in Thailand to 35. The case is linked to an old case of a Chinese family of nine, all of them have now been infected.

Feb 17.title: S. Korea reports 1 more case of novel coronavirus, total now at 30
Feb 17.detail: The country's latest patient is the 68-year-old wife of the 29th patient who tested positive for the virus Sunday. The 82-year-old man is not known to have been in contact with the country's other virus-confirmed patients or recently traveled abroad. The Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (KCDC) is struggling to find out how the couple contracted the virus amid concerns that the virus could spread rapidly among the general public. The country considers testing those who suffer from unknown causes of pneumonia for potential COVID-19 virus.

Feb 16.title: UAE announces ninth case of coronavirus
Feb 16.detail: The patient is a 37-year old Chinese man and is in stable condition. This brings the total number of cases reported in the UAE to 9 - out of which 3 cases recovered. Out of the remaining six cases, one person is Indian and another is Filipino while the rest are Chinese nationals.

Feb 16.title: 3 new COVID-19 cases in Singapore, including SAF serviceman linked to Grace Assembly of God cluster
Feb 16.detail: The serviceman was one of two new cases linked to the church. The third case is a family member of another patient. All the new cases have no recent travel history to China. This brings the total number of cases in Singapore to 75. The serviceman – case 73 – is a 43-year-old with the Republic of Singapore Air Force (RSAF).  He was identified as a close contact of case 51, who works at both of the church's branches in Tanglin and Bukit Batok. Case 74, who is also linked to the Grace Assembly of God cluster, is a 29-year-old Singaporean man who reported the onset of symptoms on Feb 12.  He sought treatment at Alexandra Hospital on the same day, and again on Feb 15, when he was admitted. He tested positive for the infection on the same afternoon. Case 75, a 71-year-old Singaporean woman is a family member of case 41 – a 71-year-old Singaporean man – and has been under quarantine since Feb 7. She was confirmed to have the infection on Feb 16 morning.

Feb 16.title: Taiwan confirms first COVID-19 death
Feb 16.detail: The deceased person was a man in his 60s who had not travelled abroad recently and had diabetes and Hepatitis B. This was the first fatality in Taiwan, where there are 20 confirmed cases.

Feb 16.title: Coronavirus Cases in Japan Exceed 400
Feb 16.detail: The total number of COVID-19 coronavirus cases confirmed in Japan reached 414 on Sunday, with new cases found in Tokyo, in Aichi Prefecture and on a quarantined cruise ship. Among those aboard the Diamond Princess cruise ship, docked at Yokohama, near Tokyo, 70 more people were confirmed infected with the virus originating in China's Wuhan. The Tokyo metropolitan government reported five new cases, including two who had close contact with a taxi driver whose infection was confirmed Thursday. The Aichi prefectural government said a resident of the prefecture's Owari region in his 60s tested positive Sunday. He is an acquaintance of an infected woman living in Nagoya, the capital of the central Japan prefecture. She and her husband, both in their 60s, were found infected after returning to Japan on Feb. 7 from their trip to Hawaii.

Feb 16.title: Husband and wife hospitalised after man becomes Hong Kong’s 57th confirmed patient
Feb 16.detail: A husband and wife have been hospitalised after the 54-year-old man tested positive for the coronavirus on Sunday, bringing the total number of confirmed cases in Hong Kong to 57. The man first visited the hospital on February 10 after he developed a fever and cough. Lung scans showed no abnormality at the time. After the symptoms persisted, the man returned to the hospital on Saturday and was admitted. His wife was hospitalised on Sunday, after she developed a runny nose and a cough.

Feb 16.title: COVID-19 cases on Diamond Princess ship rise to 355
Feb 16.detail: The number of people who have tested positive for COVID-19 on a quarantined ship off Japan's coast has risen to 355. So far, 1,219 individuals have been tested. 355 people tested positive. Of those, 73 individuals are not showing symptoms.

Feb 16.title: S. Korea reports 1 more new coronavirus case, total now at 29
Feb 16.detail: South Korea reports 1 more new coronavirus case, total now at 29

Feb 15.title: Passenger from Westerdam confirmed by Malaysia to have coronavirus
Feb 15.detail: A 83-year-old woman from the United States who was among the nearly 1,500 passengers who disembarked on Friday from a cruise ship in Cambodia and flew to Malaysia has been confirmed as being infected with the new coronavirus. The Westerdam, carrying 1,455 passengers and 802 crew, grabbed headlines after it was turned away by five ports in Asia over coronavirus fears before the Cambodian government allowed the ship to dock on Thursday on humanitarian grounds. The 83-year-old woman and her 85-year-old husband, also from the United States, were among 145 passengers who flew into Malaysia on Friday after disembarking. Airport screening discovered the couple to have symptoms. A test for the virus now known as COVID-19 came back positive for her on Saturday. Her husband tested negative although he remains hospitalized for treatment of his symptoms and observation.

Feb 15.title: Singapore confirms 5 new cases of COVID-19
Feb 15.detail: Of these, three are linked to the cluster at Grace Assembly of God church; one is linked to the cluster at Seletar Aerospace Heights construction site and the other case is linked to a previous case. This brings the total number of novel coronavirus infections in Singapore to 72.  Case 68 is a 79-year-old female Singapore citizen with no recent travel history to China. She is a family member of Case 66. Case 69 is a 26-year-old Bangladesh national who is a Singapore Work Pass holder, and has no recent travel history to China. He is linked to the cluster at Seletar Aerospace Heights construction site. Case 70 is a 27-year-old female Singapore citizen with no recent travel history to China. She is a family member of Case 66. Case 71 is a 25-year-old male Singapore citizen with no recent travel history to China. He is a contact of Case 66. Case 72 is a 40-year-old male Chinese national who is a Singapore Work Pass holder, and has no recent travel history to China. He is a non-medical contact of Case 59.

Feb 15.title: A woman in her 60s living in Nagoya city tested positive for new coronavirus infection
Feb 15.detail: A woman in her 60s living in Nagoya city tested positive on Feburary 15th for new coronavirus infection. She is the wife of a 60s male who was confirmed infected on the 14th. The couple traveled to Hawaii, USA on January 28, and returned home on February 7. Both have not traveled to China for two weeks before the onset.

Feb 15.title: France announces first coronavirus death outside Asia
Feb 15.detail: An elderly Chinese tourist hospitalised in France has died of the coronavirus, becoming the first fatality in Europe.

Feb 15.title: Tokyo confirms 8 new coronavirus cases
Feb 15.detail: Tokyo metropolitan government officials say eight more people have been confirmed to be infected with the new coronavirus. The officials say seven of the eight came into close contact with a taxi driver who was found to be infected with the virus on Thursday.

Feb 15.title: A second doctor's wife and an inpatient at a hospital there had all tested positive.
Feb 15.detail: In Wakayama Prefecture, western Japan, authorities said on Saturday a second doctor's wife and an inpatient at a hospital there had all tested positive.

Feb 15.title: 67 new infections on Diamond Princess confirmed, as US moves to evacuate citizens
Feb 15.detail: Another 67 people on board the Diamond Princess cruise ship quarantined off Japan's coast have tested positive for the new coronavirus. The new cases bring the number of people diagnosed on the Diamond Princess to 285, excluding a quarantine officer who also contracted the illness. The new reports came as the United States on Saturday announced it would evacuate Americans on board the cruise ship and bring them back to the US via chartered flight. An aircraft was expected to arrive in Japan on Sunday evening and leave Tokyo's Haneda airport the following day.

Feb 15.title: Thailand reports one new case of coronavirus, brings total to 34
Feb 15.detail: The new case is a 35-year-old Thai woman, a medical personnel, who got the disease from contact with a patient.

Feb 15.title: Malaysia confirms 2 more cases of COVID-19
Feb 15.detail: Malaysia on Saturday (Feb 15) confirmed two new COVID-19 cases, bringing the total number of people infected in the country to 21.  Both patients, a man and a woman, are Chinese nationals. The man is a 27-year-old businessman from Guangzhou, who was found having symptoms during a screening at the Bukit Kayu Customs, Immigration and Quarantine Complex in Kedah on Friday.  A throat swab was taken from him the next day, and he was confirmed positive for COVID-19. The woman, aged 32, resides in Malaysia but visited China from Jan 22 to Jan 30. She was confirmed positive for COVID-19 on Saturday morning.

Feb 15.title: 2nd doctor in Wakayama has new coronavirus
Feb 15.detail: The surgeon, who is in his 50s, works at Saiseikai Arida Hospital, where another doctor in his 50s and a patient in his 70s have both tested positive. The prefectural government is testing other doctors at the hospital, and also plans to examine nurses, other staff, and any patients who have had contact with the infected patient. The hospital stopped accepting outpatients on Friday in an effort to contain the spread of the virus.

Feb 14.title: 5th case of COVID-19 recorded in B.C.
Feb 14.detail: There is a new, presumptive positive case of COVID-19 in B.C.  This marks the fifth case of COVID-19 in the province, however the most recent case still requires confirmation from the National Microbiology Lab in Winnipeg. The new patient is a woman in her 30s, Henry said during a news conference. She is currently in isolation at home and is doing well. The woman had flown from Shanghai to Vancouver, while the risk is very low for others who were on the flight, health officials are working to get a list of all passengers who were on the same plane.

Feb 14.title: Egypt confirmed its first case of coronavirus in the country
Feb 14.detail: The Egyptian health ministry has confirmed its first case of coronavirus in the country, adding that the infected person is from overseas.

Feb 14.title: Several new cases of coronavirus infection reported in Japan on Friday. The latest cases bring the number of infected people in Japan to 259, including 218 from a cruise ship
Feb 14.detail: A man in his 70s in the western prefecture of Wakayama has been tested positive. He had temporarily stayed at a hospital where a surgeon was confirmed to be infected on Thursday. The northern prefecture of Hokkaido reported its second case. A man in Aichi prefecture, central Japan, has now been confirmed to have the virus. And a local government official in Kanagawa Prefecture, bordering Tokyo, has tested positive. He was engaged in transporting infected people from the Diamond Princess to hospitals earlier this week.

Feb 14.title: Nine new coronavirus cases in Singapore, no plans to raise outbreak alert to red
Feb 14.detail: Singapore on Friday reported nine more cases of the deadly coronavirus, bringing its total number of cases to 67. Of the nine new cases, six are linked to a previously identified cluster involving the Grace Assembly of God church. There are four other local transmission clusters: The Life Church and Missions Singapore; a construction site at Seletar Aerospace Heights; a health products shop that primarily serves Chinese tourists; and a business meeting at the Grand Hyatt Singapore.

Feb 14.title: Two people, taxi drivers in Tokyo had been newly infected with the coronavirus
Feb 14.detail: The Tokyo Metropolitan Government revealed that two taxi drivers in Tokyo had been newly infected with the coronavirus. One is a worker at a local taxi association and another is an individual who worked on a party boat. The worker on the party boat reportedly had contact with a traveler from Hubei. About 80 people from the taxi association, including the driver, attended a boat party on Jan. 18 and 10 of them are showing symptoms.

Feb 14.title: Hong Kong confirms three new cases, bringing city’s total to 56
Feb 14.detail: Hong Kong reported three more confirmed coronavirus infections as of Friday, bringing the total number of cases in the city to 56. The Centre for Health Protection said one of the three cases involved a man in critical condition after suffering shortness of breath for more than 10 days.  Another person who tested positive for the virus, which causes the disease known as Covid-19, was the cousin of a previously infected case. Both attended a family gathering of 29 at a restaurant in North Point on January 26. At least six other members at that gathering have been infected with the new deadly virus, while at least two are still in quarantine pending test results. The third case is a worker in a dim sum restaurant in Sheung Wan, whose husband visited their son in Xinhui, Guangdong province, from January 23 to January 28. Her husband and son are not infected.

Feb 14.title: First coronavirus case confirmed in Okinawa
Feb 14.detail: Officials of Japan's Okinawa Prefecture say they've confirmed an infection of the new coronavirus, the first such case in the Kyushu region including Okinawa. A female taxi driver in her 60s tested positive for the virus. They say she very likely had contact with passengers of the cruise ship Diamond Princess, which called at Naha Port on February 1. The ship later went to Yokohama Port, but has been quarantined there because of an onboard viral outbreak. The driver had a cough and was tested for the virus after a doctor suspected she had pneumonia.

Feb 14.title: Patient in his 70s at infected doctor's hospital tested positive for coronavirus
Feb 14.detail: A man in his 70s who was treated at a hospital in western Japan where a doctor was recently confirmed to have been infected with a new coronavirus has also tested positive for it. The doctor, a surgeon in his 50s, was confirmed Thursday to have become the first doctor in Japan to be infected with COVID-19. The man in his 70s, whose infection with the virus was confirmed Thursday, has developed severe pneumonia. He initially developed symptoms on Feb. 1, began running a fever on Feb. 5. The infected doctor had symptoms of fever and fatigue on Jan. 31 and took two days off but worked Feb. 3-5 by taking antipyretics. He was diagnosed with pneumonia on Feb. 8 and was hospitalized two days later.

Feb 13.title: CDC Confirms 15th Case of Coronavirus in the United States
Feb 13.detail: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) on Thursday confirmed the 15th case of the coronavirus in the United States. The case is the first person under quarantine at the airbase in Texas among a group of people that arrived from China on Feb. 7 who had symptoms and tested positive for the disease.

Feb 13.title: Hong Kong’s total number of cases rises to 53
Feb 13.detail: Three more cases were confirmed in Hong Kong. One of three new cases in Hong Kong was connected to an earlier case, both of whom had shared a family meal with 11 others on January 30. The patient, a 43-year-old man, was an insurance worker who lived in Tuen Mun and worked in Yau Ma Tei. He had no recent travel history and developed a cough on January 29, followed by vomiting and diarrhoea. His fellow diner at the family meal, Hong Kong's 47th confirmed case.  Thursday's other two new cases – a 67-year-old woman and her son, 37 – had also dined with earlier confirmed cases, at the Star Seafood Restaurant in North Point on the evening of January 26.

Feb 13.title: Japan confirmed another coronavirus case
Feb 13.source: Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare
Feb 13.detail: A male patient in his 20's developed on February 2 and has been hospitalized at a medical institution in Chiba Prefecture since February 10, and a positive result was found on February 13 as a result of a test at a local health research institute in Chiba Prefecture.

Feb 13.title: Japan confirms 1st coronavirus death
Feb 13.detail: A Japanese woman in her 80s infected with the new coronavirus died Thursday, becoming the country's first confirmed fatality. The woman from Kanagawa Prefecture near the Japanese capital, who had not traveled overseas recently. She had been diagnosed with pneumonia and hospitalized since Feb. 1 and her breathing deteriorated on Feb. 6.

Feb 13.title: Eight new cases in Singapore, bringing total to 58
Feb 13.detail: The eight new cases are linked to previous cases. Five of them are Singaporeans and are linked to an infection cluster associated with the Grace Assembly of God churches, while two are Bangladeshi nationals connected with previously-diagnosed patients who worked at a construction site at the Seletar Aerospace Heights. Three more clusters were previously identified by officials, including a health products shop that primarily serves Chinese tourists, a business meeting at the Grand Hyatt Singapore, and another church The Life Church and Missions Singapore. Among the new cases is a 54-year-old professor at the National University of Singapore, who has no travel history to China.

Feb 13.title: Tourist from Wuhan is 19th Covid-19 case in Malaysia
Feb 13.detail: A 39-year-old tourist from Wuhan, China, is the 19th confirmed case of Covid-19 in Malaysia. The woman is a friend to and the daughter of two other China nationals, who were 14th and 16th Covid-19 cases identified in Malaysia. The woman arrived in Malaysia from China on Jan 25 with four other women. As soon the two others – her friend and her mother – tested positive for the coronavirus on Feb 5 and Feb 7, she was put under home surveillance and monitoring. She began developing symptoms such as cough and fever on Feb 12. She was then admitted to the Kuala Lumpur Hospital. Tests conducted on the same day found her positive for Covid-19.

Feb 13.title: Japan confirmed a new coronavirus case
Feb 13.source: Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare
Feb 13.detail: A male patient in his 50's developed fever on January 31 and has been hospitalized at a hospital in the Wakayama prefecture since February 10, and as a result of a test at the local health research institute in the prefecture, a positive result was found on February 13.

Feb 13.title: Vietnam confirms 16th coronavirus patient
Feb 13.detail: A 50-year-old man in Vinh Phuc Province, the father of one of the infected Vietnamese workers of Japan-based Nihon Plast Company Limited who’d been sent to Wuhan for training last November, has tested positive for novel coronavirus

Feb 13.title: 44 more cases on Diamond Princess cruise ship anchored off Japan
Feb 13.detail: There have now been 218 cases confirmed on the cruise ship, taking the total number of infections in Japan to 247. Of the newly diagnosed infections, 43 are passengers, and one a member of the crew.  Authorities now want to move elderly people off the ship if they test negative for the virus, offering to put them in government-designated lodging. There are now questions about whether the quarantine on the ship is working, with dozens of new cases diagnosed almost daily.

Feb 13.title: 14th case of new coronavirus confirmed in the U.S.
Feb 13.detail: The patient is one of the passengers who arrived on a State Department-chartered flight from Wuhan, China, to Marine Corps Air Station Miramar in San Diego on Friday. All passengers on that flight have been under a federal 14-day quarantine since arriving in the U.S. This is the second passenger from Wuhan to be diagnosed. The two patients were on different flights and have had no contact.

Feb 12.title: Ninth case found in UK
Feb 12.detail: A woman who flew into London from China a few days ago is being treated for coronavirus, bringing the total number of UK cases to nine.

Feb 12.title: 3 new cases of COVID-19 in Singapore, including DBS employee, 2 church employees
Feb 12.detail: Of them, two are from the Grace Assembly of God church, and one of them works at DBS bank at the Marina Bay Financial Centre. All three of them are Singaporean and have no recent travel history to mainland China. The two patients linked to the church are two male employees aged 34 and 46. The church will stop all church services and activities for two weeks. The DBS employee is 62 years old. This brings the number of confirmed cases of the virus in Singapore to 50.

Feb 12.title: Hong Kong reports 50th confirmed case
Feb 12.detail: The patient is a 51-year-old restaurant worker and colleague of a woman who attended a family hotpot meal that was linked to 11 other infections.

Feb 11.title: Japan cruise ship coronavirus cases climb to 175, including quarantine officer
Feb 11.detail: Another 39 people have tested positive for the coronavirus on the quarantined Diamond Princess cruise ship in Japan as well as one quarantine officer, bringing the total to 175.

Feb 11.title: Thailand reports 1 new case of coronavirus, brings total to 33
Feb 11.detail: The new case is a 54-year-old Chinese woman from Wuhan who was put in quarantine after coming into contact with another Chinese virus patient while in Thailand.

Feb 11.title: Germany confirms two more cases of coronavirus, raising overall number to 16
Feb 11.detail: The two new cases of coronavirus are related to infections among staff at a company in the Starnberg district west of Munich. Car supplier Webasto said last month a Chinese employee had tested positive for the virus upon returning to China following a visit to the headquarters near Munich. The employee apparently infected several German colleagues during the visit.

Feb 11.title: Seven more cases confirmed in Hong Kong, taking city’s total number to 49
Feb 11.detail: One of the new cases was connected to a shared family hotpot meal during Lunar New Year while three more were related to the 42nd case, a woman who lives at Hong Mei House in Tsing Yi's Cheung Hong Estate. The woman's son and his wife, who stayed with her, as well as the son's father-in-law, were all infected. They had some gatherings and activities during Lunar New Year, but no travel history. Three other cases concerning a 59-year-old church employee who worked in Siu Sai Wan, a 71-year-old man who lived in Po Lam Estate and a 66-year-old Tuen Mun resident, were not connected to previous clusters.

Feb 11.title: 2 new coronavirus cases in Singapore, including second Bangladeshi worker and RWS casino employee
Feb 11.detail: One had worked at the same location as another Bangladeshi coronavirus patient, the other is a Singapore permanent resident (PR) who lives in Johor Bahru and works at Resorts World Sentosa Casino. This brings the number of cases in Singapore to 47, with seven in critical condition. A total of 25 cases in Singapore are local transmissions.
